intro: Jambosa glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular jambosa, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are often dispersed by wind. Jambosa glandulosa is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories.
